abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment of
            the Agricultural Services and Producer Organizations Project
            for Mali which strengthens and revamps the national
            agriculture research and extension systems, supports
            producer organizations, and provides institutional support
            to the Ministry of Rural Development. This report examines
            the negative environmental impacts anticipated from the
            project and suggests mitigations. Indiscriminate expansion
            into the arid lands should be cautiously held in check, and
            intensification of agriculture in the high potential areas,
            must be associated with appropriate land use practices. Soil
            erosion and degradation is already a serious problem and
            sustainability of the natural resource base must be
            apriority in the strategy. While the increased use of
            inorganic fertilizers and pesticides are important to
            increase productivity and output, this must be associated
            with an integrated "agro-ecological" approach to
            agricultural research and extension which stress
            conservation measures such as maintaining vegetative cover
            and retention of soil organic matter as well as integrated
            pest management. During negotiation assurances were obtained
            that the Government would have applied standards and
            procedures for using agricultural chemicals in connection
            with agricultural extension activities; and includes a
            Safeguard Policy with a specific provision for co-financing
            the removal of obsolete pesticide stock throughout the country.
